If you want to use TeamMentor locally only, use Cassini. If you want to expose the TeamMentor on a web server to your team, use IIS. 

To run TeamMentor locally, there is no installation needed, once the TeamMentor files are available locally, the only step required is to start the Cassini web server using the provided batch file

  1. Copy TeamMentor files to local folder
    • Download the .zip file of TeamMentor and extract it
    • You can also do a Git Clone of the desired version of TeamMentor from GitHub

  2. The TeamMentor root folder should contain the following folders:
    • Library_Data - this folder contains the library files.
    • Web Application - this folder contains the application files.

  3. (Optional) Set the local TeamMentor port
    • Open the "start webserver.bat" file with a text editor.
    • Edit the "/port" argument in the following line:
      • start "WebServer" "WebServer/CassiniDev.exe" /port:12345 /portMode:Specific /path:"Web Applications\TM_Website"
    • Set same port on the next line
      • start http://127.0.0.1:12345

  4. Start local WebServer (using batch file)
    • Double-click on the "start webserver.bat" file to start the web server on the defined port
    • The default web browser should open automatically with the TeamMentor web site
